articles.title: Mongolian President Meets DPRK Delegation
articles.content:
Mongolian President Meets DPRK Delegation
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the Ministry of People's Security of the DPRK led by Minister Choe Pu Il in his state office on Wednesday.
					 The president said that the delegation's visit is of great significance as it takes place this significant year which marks the 25th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's historic visit to Mongolia and the 65th anniversary of opening of diplomatic ties between the  two countries.
					
					 He expressed his will to contribute to promoting the friendly relations provided by the leaders of the two countries, steadily carrying forward the good tradition and boosting economic cooperation.
					
					 Present there were the Mongolian minister of Justice, the advisor to the president on nature and living environment policy of Mongolia, the Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, personages concerned and  the DPRK ambassador to Mongolia.

articles.title: Talks between Choe Pu Il and Minister of Justice of Mongolia Held
articles.content:
Talks between Choe Pu Il and Minister of Justice of Mongolia Held
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Talks between Choe Pu Il, minister of People's Security of the DPRK, who is heading the delegation of the Ministry on a visit to Mongolia and Temuujin Khishigdemberel, minister of Justice of Mongolia, were held on Wednesday.
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were members of the delegation and the DPRK ambassador to Mongolia and from the Mongolian side the secretary of State of the Ministry of Justice, the Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK and personages concerned.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of further developing exchange and cooperation between the security organs of the two countries and matters of mutual concern.
					
					 The talks took place in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Brunei Here
articles.content:
Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Brunei Here
Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- His Highness Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Brunei Mohamed Bolkiah and his party arrived here Friday.
					 Vice-minister of Foreign Affairs Pak Kil Yon greeted them at the airport.

articles.title: Reception Given in Honor of Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Brunei
articles.content:
Reception Given in Honor of Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Brune
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government gave a reception in honor of the visiting minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Brunei at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday.
					 Present there on invitation were His Highness Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Brunei Mohamed Bolkiah and his party and Magdalene Teo, Brunei ambassador to DPRK.
					
					 Vice-President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly Yang Hyong Sop, Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Pak Kil Yon and officials concerned were present at the banquet.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Pak Ui Chun said that the Brunei government has made efforts to achieve regional peace and stability, development and prosperity as the chair country of ASEAN.
					
					 He noted that the DPRK government would boost the bilateral relations with Brunei and closely cooperate with it in the international arena including ASEAN and UN in the future, too.
					
					 Mohamed Bolkiah congratulated the Korean people on significantly celebrating the 60th anniversary of victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 He expressed his belief that the bilateral relations would go stronger through mutual visits, appreciating the close cooperation between the officials of the two foreign ministries.

articles.title: Chinese Special Envoy Flies Back
articles.content:
Chinese Special Envoy Flies Back
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Wu Dawei, special envoy of the Chinese government for the issue of the Korean Peninsula, and his party flew back home Friday.

articles.title: Women's Premier League Begins
articles.content:
Women's Premier League Begins
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Women's premier soccer league matches began at Kim Il Sung Stadium in celebration of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK amid keen interest of experts and fans. 
					 Divided into four groups, 12 teams will play league matches. 
					
					 Four top teams from each group will play a tournament. 
					
					 The matches between the April 25 and Wolmido teams and between Sobaeksu and Amnokgang teams took place on Friday. 
					
					 The April 25 Team made hot attacks, taking the initiative. 
					
					 At the end of the second half of the game a player of the April 25 Team made a smart long kick, scoring a goal. It trounced its rival 1:0.
					
					 Then followed a match between Sobaeksu and Amnokgang teams. 
					
					 The Sobaeksu Team beat its rival 2:1.

articles.title: Kim Pyong Hun, Noted Novelist of DPRK
articles.content:
Kim Pyong Hun, Noted Novelist of DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, on April 28 sent a wreath to the bier of Kim Pyong Hun, ex-chairman of the C.C., General Federation of the Unions of Art and Literature of Korea, expressing deep condolences over his death.
					 Born into a worker's family in North Hamgyong Province, Kim Pyong Hun went to northeast China to eke out living. He returned home after the country's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule.
					
					 As the Korean War (1950-1953) broke out, he joined the Korean People's Army to fight in the front. And in Juche 41 (1952) he was recalled from the front to study at Kim Hyong Jik University of Education.
					
					 After the graduation of the university, he wrote a number of short novels, including "Companions" and "Letter from Haeju-Hasong Railway Project Site", which represented forerunners in carrying out President Kim Il Sung's instructions.
					
					 Since then, he had been well known among local people.
					
					 Kim, who began his career as a writer in the first half of the 1960s, had been active as a writer of the April 15 Literary Production Center and as chairman of the Central Committee of the Writers Union of Korea.
					
					 During the days, he wrote a full-length novel "Youthful Days", which features young people who became communists under the guidance of Kim Il Sung in the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 He was one of the writers who novelized the immortal classics "The Fate of a Self-Defence Corps Man" and "The Flower Girl".
					
					 His hit was the "The Grim Battle Area", a serial novel of "Immortal History", which deals with the revolutionary activities of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Honored with the audience of President Kim Il Sung on several occasions, Kim Pyong Hun was a winner of the Order of Kim Il Sung, Kim Il Sung Prize and the title of Labor Hero.

articles.title: Signal Achievements Reported from Economic Sector of DPRK
articles.content:
Signal Achievements Reported from Economic Sector of DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Officials and workers of the DPRK have achieved signal achievements in the economic sector from the outset of the year in hearty response to the historic New Year Address made by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					 Having honored their first quarter year plans, coal miners of the country waged a dynamic campaign to greet the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War with great labor achievements.
					
					 Workers of the hydro-power stations have fulfilled their monthly and quarterly plans by maintaining a high level of water and ensuring a high operation rate of equipment.
					
					 Signal successes in electricity production were reported from different thermal power plants. The Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex carried out its July power quota ahead of schedule. The Chongchongang Thermal Power Plant generated 20 percent more electricity than in the corresponding period of last year.
					
					 Officials and workers of the iron and steel production bases including the Chollima Steel Complex and the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex significantly boosted production while consolidating the foundation for producing the Juche iron.
					
					 Miners of the Musan Mining Complex secured a lot of mining areas by carrying out blasting of 200,000 and 400,000 cubic meters of earth from the outset of the year. As a result, they produced 10,000 tons of concentrated iron ore outside their plan in recent months.
					
					 Officials and workers of the railway bureaus in Pyongyang, Kaechon, Hamhung, Chongjin and Rason successfully ensured the transport of freight to major factories, enterprises and big construction sites.
					
					 This month railway bureaus of Pyongyang and Kaechon transported over 1.4 times more freight to the field of light industry than planned.
					
					 The production of fertilizers including urea and ammonium nitrate fertilizers in the first half of the year went up more than 10 percent as compared with last year in the large chemical industrial bases.
					
					 Units associated with leadership exploits of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu of the Ministry of Light Industry including the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill, the Songyo Knitted Goods Factory and the Pyongyang Hosiery Factory have taken the lead in the drive for increased production.
					
					 Factories under the Ministry of Food and Consumer Goods Industries boosted production 40 percent in the significant July as against the previous month and brought about uninterrupted boost in August, too, through an all-out onward march.
					
					 Cooperative farms across the country are busy making good preparations for harvest and threshing, while directing their efforts to the manuring and cultivation of crops.
					
					  Stockbreeding bases across the country honored their first quarterly plans and the National Fruit Agency overfulfilled its quotas for planting fruit trees in spring more than 30 percent.
					
					 Workers of the machine-building industry carried out the plans for gross industrial output value for the first half of the year and July at 130 percent and 117 percent respectively.
					
					 Mines, factories and enterprises under the Management Bureau of Phosphate Fertilizer Industry of the Ministry of Mining Industry carried out the plan for fertilizer production for the manuring year at 142 percent by July and started the production for the next manuring year this month.
					
					 In this period the yearly plan for the production of apatite concentrate jumped 60 percent and phosphate fertilizer production 150 percent as compared with the previous year.
					
					 Many timber and forestry stations honored their yearly timber production plans ahead of schedule.
					
					 Many projects were completed and commissioned this year to step up the building of a thriving nation and contribute to improving the people's living standard.
					
					 The employees, technicians and officials of the Kangson Steel Complex finished a huge project of building a gas generation shop and high temperature air combustion heavy-duty heating furnace for rolling.
					
					 The Manpho Yonha Power Station has gone operational.
					
					 The Pyongyang Essential Foodstuff Factory was successfully remodeled into a modern one having an up-to-date material and technical foundation and cultural environment.
					
					 A velvet shop was built at the Pakchon Silk Mill and the production processes of the Phyongsong Synthetic Leather Factory were updated and there sprang up the Vitamin C production base having latest production process based on bio-engineering.
					
					 The Komdok Mining Complex technologically updated the Grinding Shop of Dressing Plant No. 3. The construction project of a large-size zinc oxide production process and the first-phase liquefying process were completed at the Tanchon Smeltery.
					
					 The Taethan Taehung Mine went operational and a big and promising cement factory appeared in Sinwon, South Hwanghae Province.
					
					 A ferrosilicon production process appeared at the Haeju Kumgang Youth Smeltery and new finishing building materials production process was built at the Taedonggang Tile Factory and began production. 
					
					 Comprehensive livestock production bases and greenhouses appeared in Pyongyang City, North Phyongan Province, Ryanggang Province, South Hamgyong Province and South Hwanghae Province to contribute to improving the living standard of the people.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Criticizes Some Western Countries for Banning Export of Ski Equipment to DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Criticizes Some Western Countries for Banning Export of Ski Equipment to DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Some Western European countries have opposed the export of cableway equipment to be installed at ski resort on Masik Pass in the DPRK, dancing to the tune of the U.S. move to stifle the DPRK.
					 To justify their acts, they are contending that the construction of the ski resort is aimed to give good publicity to its social system and that the equipment belongs to "luxury goods" whose export to the DPRK is banned under the UN "sanctions". They are even making such remarks that it is unbelievable that ordinary people of the DPRK use ski resort on Masik Pass and ski is what only high-class people do.
					
					 This is an intolerable mockery of the social system and the people of the DPRK and a serious human rights abuse that politicizes sports and discriminates against the Koreans.
					
					 The "democratic countries" advocating "equality of all people", "defence of human rights" and "freedom" are unhesitatingly resorting to criminal hostile act of violating the dignity of a sovereign state in the eyes of the international community in a bid to deprive Koreans of their elementary right to enjoy a cultural life. 
					
					 Ski resort on Masik Pass is a popular sports facility whose construction is under way under the plan of the Workers' Party of Korea to provide youth and other people with highly civilized living conditions.
					
					 Its users are the Koreans who are creating happiness with their own hands by relying on their own efforts as the master of the country as well as tourists and sports fans from countries around the world.
					
					 No wonder, the special adviser to the Secretary General of the United Nations on Sports for Development and Peace, when interviewed by the south Korean Chungang Ilbo on August 23, expressed sympathy with the popular policies enforced in the DPRK, saying that he had good impressions of the DPRK during his visit to the country. The state is deeply concerned about sports which have become part of the daily life of the people and sports facilities are in wide use in the DPRK, he said. He added that sports facility which caught his greatest interest was ski resort on Masik Pass, noting that when completed, the resort is supposed to receive foreign tourists as well as south Korean tourists like Mt. Kumgang resort.
					
					 Skiing is one of sports events loved by all people, men and women, young and old, in lots of countries around the world.
					
					 There are thousands of ski resorts in various regions of the world and their users number tens of million.
					
					 Not only countries with good natural and geographic conditions for skiing but also tropical countries direct efforts into developing ski events.
					
					 Swiss people were fond of skiing despite poverty in the past centuries and lots of Swiss are engaged in the business of developing ski now.
					
					 It is self-deluding to say that ski belongs to those high-class people. 
					
					 Countries which styled themselves "highly civilized nations" have spoiled its own dignity and image in the world's eyes, under the pressure by the U.S. bent on the hostile policy toward the DPRK. This can not but be a tragedy.
					
					 No matter how desperately the U.S. and other hostile forces may resort to despicable acts in the international arena, pursuant to their high-handed and arbitrary practices, ski resort on Masik Pass will appear imposingly as a symbol of the high civilization of Korea and its heroic spirit.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Establishing Int'l Order of Respecting Sovereignty
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Establishing Int'l Order of Respecting Sovereignty
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- In order to ensure the world peace it is an essential to establish an international order of respecting sovereignty, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					 The article goes on:
					
					 High-handed and arbitrary practices based on the theory of strength and double-standards are now allowed in international relations and the acts of violating sovereignty including the use of power, interference in internal affairs and sanctions have become undisguised.
					
					 Nevertheless, measures have not been taken to eradicate these acts and international organizations are misused for justifying them
					
					 The western forces including the U.S. have used the political and military pressures, economic sanctions and psychological warfare as the main weapon of violating the state sovereignty of developing countries.
					
					 These moves of outside forces resulted in wreaking havoc with internal affairs of other countries, making the "coloring revolution" sweep across the Eastern European and Arabic regions and toppling legitimate governments. And independent countries against imperialism including Iran, Syria and Venezuela have faced difficulties in the economic development and social life owing to various kinds of pressures and sanctions imposed by the West.
					
					 The U.S. and the Western forces speak loudly of "ensuring human rights" and "deterring the development of weapons of mass destruction", while citing them as a pretext of armed interference.
					
					 Through such moves they seek to establish the international order governed by jungle law and neo-colonial order to justify their interference in internal affairs, aggression and plunder.
					
					 History clearly shows that the moves of aggression forces to violate sovereignty of other countries would put global peace and security in serious peril.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Accused of Turning S. Korea into Tundra of Human Rights
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Accused of Turning S. Korea into Tundra of Human Rights
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the south Korean regime let the prime minister bring to Seoul riff-raffs of the fact-finding group of the human rights in north Korea fabricated by the UN Human Rights Council, a plot-breeding tool and puppet of the U.S., in order to stage a charade aimed to institute "a law on human rights in the north".
					 The puppet group should have felt the blame for having turned south Korea into the worst tundra of human rights by reviving the fascist rule.  It is, however, busy kicking up an anti-DPRK human rights campaign, raising a hue and cry over someone's non-existent "human rights issue." Nothing is more shameless behavior than this.
					
					 It is nonsensical to discuss the democratic rights of the people and their human rights in south Korea.
					
					 As well known to everybody, the puppet conservative group last year was busy building up public opinion to create conditions in favor of the election of the candidate from the ruling party by mobilizing the Intelligence Service as a shock brigade in a bid to bar the democratic forces desirous of independence, democracy and reunification from coming to power. 
					
					 Utterly taken aback by the mounting candlelight actions and events for issuing declarations on the situation in demand of the resignation of the present chief executive and the punishment of those involved in the wake of disclosure of crimes, the regime ruthlessly trampled down the freedom and rights of the people, revealing its fascist nature.
					
					 The fascists set in motion the Intelligence Service and the Security Investigation Group on June 26 to search the South Headquarters of the National Alliance for Korea's Reunification and arrested its secretary general and its director for cooperation with other countries. Then they detained a member of the organizational committee of the headquarters and others and persecuted them. The member was suffering from a serious illness due the aftermath of the 17 year-long prison life during the "yusin" fascist dictatorship. They also held trials of four persons including the permanent representative of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, kicking up terror-ridden atmosphere.
					
					 When broad segments of people staged a demonstration in Seoul on August 15 denouncing the IS's interference in the election, the police authorities walked away demonstrators, firing water cannon mixed with tear liquid at them.
					
					 They threatened the students who participated in the candlelight rallies to appear at the police station and committed such human rights abuses as investigating e-mails of members of the Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty on absurd charge that they denounced their illegal acts.
					
					 It is none other than the present regime which is suppressing the working masses in their struggle for their vital rights.
					
					 The case of Ssangyong Motors which sparked off a big furor in south Korea in 2009 has not been settled under the present regime which calls for "the era of people's happiness".
					
					 The fascists removed even incense-burning altar which was set up to honor the memory of the workers of the Trade Union of Ssangyong Motors who were killed and their bereaved families and unhesitatingly committed such inhuman acts as arresting the head of a branch of the trade union who grew weak after staging a hunger strike for over 40 days.
					
					 More than seven million families or 45 percent of all residents in south Korea are homeless and at least 10 million people are below the poverty line due to the fascist and inhuman rule.
					
					 There are 2.75 million jobless young people who graduated from universities, a serious social problem. South Korea is a de facto tundra of human rights where more than 40 persons commit suicides every day, lamenting over cursed society.

articles.title: S. Korean People's Actions against IS's Illegal Interference in Election Intensified
articles.content:
S. Korean People's Actions against IS's Illegal Interference in Election Intensified
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- South Korean people's actions became unabated in August, too, to demand probe into the truth behind the Intelligence Service's illegal interference in the 2012 "presidential election," an operation to build up public opinion in favor of the ruling party's candidate. 
					 Press conferences were held by the Emergency Situation Council to Denounce IS Interference in Presidential Election for Political Operation which consists of more than 200 civic and social organizations, the "students' movement for nullifying the 18th presidential election and resignation of President Park Geun Hye", the Unified Progressive Party, the solidarity for lifting of discrimination against disable persons and other organizations and opposition parties. 
					
					 The organizations and opposition parties called upon the people of different social standings to turn out in the emergency action and massive candlelight action, warning that if the chief executive evades the responsibility for the IS interference in the election, hiding herself in Chongwadae, and the "government" tries to cover up the case and violation of democracy, they will face stronger resistance of the people. 
					
					 100,000-strong candlelight rallies were staged in Seoul, Pusan, Taejon, Taegu and Ulsan areas with representatives of civic and social organizations, lawmakers from opposition parties and youth and students involved. 
					
					 The federation of university students held a meeting near the U.S. embassy to form a grand march team for reunification and declared that it would vigorously wage an all-people signature campaign and movement for defending peace. 
					
					 A people's movement for issuing declarations on the situation is gaining in scope and strength. 
					
					 At least 110 professors of Kyunghee University took part in the movement for issuing a declaration on the situation and staged a demonstration, shouting "Probe the truth behind the IS interference in the election". 
					
					 1 954 media persons, Catholic Suwon Parish, at least 600 students of Korea University and the Kwangju-South Jolla peasants' solidarity made up of peasants organizations in the areas of Kwangju and  South Jolla Province said in the declaration on the situation that the "Saenuri Party" and the authorities' actions are criminal acts of stamping out democracy of society. 
					
					 Believers of the Christian Joint Measure Committee against IS Interference in the Election held prayers denouncing the crimes of the "Saenuri Party". 
					
					 The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty, internet paper Saram Ilbo and other broadcasting services, newspapers and organizations made public statements and articles holding that shutting one's eyes to the struggle of different people denouncing the IS interference in the election is a social crime. 
					
					 The participants in the candlelight rally on Aug. 23 urged the chief executive to introduce a special investigation aimed at thoroughly probing the truth about the IS  illegal acts, declaring that people of all social standings would launch a one-million signature campaign.

articles.title: Mass Killings of Koreans by Japanese Imperialists during Great Kanto Quake Exposed
articles.content:
Mass Killings of Koreans by Japanese Imperialists during Great Kanto Quake Exposed 
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- There took place a meeting in Yokohama, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan on August 24 to disclose the truth about the mass killings of Koreans committed by the Japanese imperialists during the great Kanto quake.
					 Present there were Koreans in Japan and Japanese citizens.
					
					 Shown at the meeting was a film "Hidden Fingernail Scratch" which shows the massacres of Koreans by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 The film was produced by a Korean in Japan in 1983. It deals with the fate of the Koreans taken to Japan during the Japanese imperialist colonial rule and the misfortunes and pain suffered by them due to the mass killings of Koreans committed by the Japanese authorities during the great Kanto quake.
					
					 Then a lecture was given under the sponsorship of the Kanagawa committee for marking the lapse of 90 years since the massacre of Koreans during the great Kanto quake.
					
					 A lecturer and a speaker explained how the monument to the Koreans killed during the great quake was erected in Yahiro of Sumida Ward.
					
					 They referred to the testimonies made by witnesses, mass killings and the fact that even  the names of most of the victims have not been known, adding they would continue conducting activities to make the truth about the massacre known to posterity.
					
					 Japan should own the responsibility for the massacre of Koreans without fail, they held, calling on all to take active part in the Kanagawa meeting for commemorating the lapse of 90 years since massacre of Koreans during the great Kanto quake slated to take place on September 1.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Nepalese Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Nepalese Newspaper
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The third part of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" was carried by the Nepalese newspaper Charcha on Aug. 26.
					 The work, published on Aug. 4, Juche 86 (1997), deals with the immortal exploits President Kim Il Sung performed in accomplishing the cause of national reunification.
					
					 Kim Jong Il in his work formulated the three principles of national reunification, the ten-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as the three charters for national reunification.
					
					 The work clarifies tasks and ways for accomplishing the cause of national reunification on the basis of the three charters.
					
					 The newspaper carried a photo of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Exploits Introduced in Various Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Exploits Introduced in Various Countries
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Organizations and institutions of various countries posted articles on their websites in the period from Aug. 19 to 22 on the occasion of the 53rd anniversary of Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea in its article titled "Songun Korea" said:
					
					 When looking back on the history of Korea, its appearance one century ago was the miserable one of a weak colonial country.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung who pioneered the Songun revolutionary cause put an end to the distress-torn history of the Korean nation. 
					
					 Kim Il Sung who embarked upon the road of revolution in his teens founded the Juche idea, the Songun idea.
					
					 With neither state-backing home front nor assistance of a regular army he organized and waged the anti-Japanese war and accomplished the historic cause of national liberation on Aug. 15, 1945.
					
					 He inflicted a heavy defeat upon the U.S. imperialist aggressors when they ignited the Korean war, and honorably defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country.
					
					 In the postwar period he resolutely smashed the U.S. imperialists' persistent moves for aggression with his Songun leadership.
					
					 The Songun revolutionary cause pioneered by Kim Il Sung was successfully carried forward by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il who started his Songun revolutionary leadership on Aug. 25, 1960 held higher the banner of Songun late in the 20th century.
					
					 He made ceaseless inspections of the army units, preparing its service personnel as fighters strong in idea and faith. He directed primary efforts to the development of the national defence industry, bolstering up the defence capability of the country and turning the whole country into an impregnable fortress.
					
					 The DPRK is led by Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un who is identical to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Kim Jong Il Library of Ecuador, the Ecuadorian Group of Youths of Juche and the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship in their articles titled "August 25 of Songun" and "For Peace" praised the immortal Songun leadership exploits of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Russian Paper Praises Kim Il Sung on Day of Liberation of Korea
articles.content:
Russian Paper Praises Kim Il Sung on Day of Liberation of Korea
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The Russian newspaper Patriot No. 30 allotted its four pages to special write-ups illustrated with photos of President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and supreme leader Kim Jong Un to mark the 68th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 An article titled "In eternal memory" said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung set forth a line of armed struggle in his early days when he started out his struggle for the liberation and independence of the country.
					
					 The Pochonbo battle waged by the Korean People's Revolutionary Army led by Kim Il Sung, brilliant strategist, on June 4, 1937 was widely known to the world.
					
					 The superb war methods created by him during the anti-Japanese armed struggle left many legends to people.
					
					 World people realized once again through the military parade held in Pyongyang some time ago that the DPRK is an invincible power equipped with modern military hardware.
					
					 The secret of the DPRK's victory lies in that the people have united as one under the banner of Songun held high by Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Another article titled "Forward to a fresh victory" said the DPRK always wins victory thanks to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK's Anniversaries Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Anniversaries Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Foreign countries held various events from Aug. 21 to 23 to mark the 53rd anniversary of Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership and the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 They included book and photo exhibitions, seminars and film shows in Benin, Brazil and Romania.
					
					 Pascal Zouncheme, chief of the Benin Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said General Secretary Kim Jong Il changed Korea into a politico-ideological power characterized by the single-minded unity by pursuing Songun politics.
					
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, noted Kim Jong Il's Songun leadership has been succeeded by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman of the Brazilian Committee for Remembering Leader Kim Jong Il and other public figures praised President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for performing the undying feats in founding and developing the DPRK.
					
					 Daniel Dediu, vice-chairman of the Romanian preparatory committee for marking the 65th anniversary of the DPRK and chairman of the Romanian Workers' Association, said the DPRK achieved a remarkable development in all fields under the outstanding leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. He added that the DPRK is shining as a socialist power of Juche and has become the beacon of hope for progressive humankind.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event in Benin.

articles.title: Anniversary of DPRK to Be Marked in Norway
articles.content:
Anniversary of DPRK to Be Marked in Norway
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee to mark the 65th anniversary of the DPRK was inaugurated in Ostfold County, Norway on Aug. 25.
					 Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway, and Rita Berger, chief of the Ostfold Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, were elected co-chairmen of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize diverse political and cultural events.

articles.title: Reckless Remarks of S. Korean Chief Executive Denounced in UK
articles.content:
Reckless Remarks of S. Korean Chief Executive Denounced in UK
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British branch of the Korean Friendship Association made public a joint statement on Aug. 21 in denunciation of the bellicose remarks made by the chief executive of south Korea. 
					 The statement said the chief executive of south Korea convened a "state security meeting" at the underground war commanding post of Chongwadae shortly ago. Her remarks were clearly aimed at inciting war hysteria against the DPRK, it added. 
					
					 Her remarks calling for "getting combat-ready regardless of change in the south-north relations and the situation in surrounding areas" showed that she is denying dialogue with the DPRK and spoiling it and trying to live depending on outside forces including the U.S. pursuant to the old and reactionary policy of confrontation, it said. 
					
					 It expressed full support for the Aug. 20 statement of the spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea. 
					
					 It urged the south Korean authorities to stop making such provocative and evil remarks and halt the war exercises for aggression with the U.S., in particular.

articles.title: Bear Fur, Gift to Kim Il Sung from Romania
articles.content:
Bear Fur, Gift to Kim Il Sung from Romania
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- On display at the International Friendship Exhibition House in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea is a bear fur, presented to President Kim Il Sung by Romanian President Nicolae Ceausescu.
					 In May Juche 64 (1975) Kim Il Sung paid an official goodwill visit to Romania.
					
					 After having talks with the Romanian president at his villa, Kim Il Sung had a walking with him in the garden. One of the topics of their conversation was bear hunting.
					
					 Learning that Kim Il Sung had a good knowledge about bear hunting, Ceausescu told his officials to fetch bear furs to present them as a gift.
					
					 Showing them to Kim Il Sung, he told that those furs were of the bears he personally hunted and they won gold, silver and bronze medals respectively at the International Bear Fur Exhibition. Then, he requested Kim Il Sung to select one of them.
					
					 Looking at them, Kim Il Sung chose the bronze-medal fur and said, "I am afraid you would be sorry if I take the gold-medal fur."
					
					 At the moment, Ceausescu was deeply moved by Kim Il Sung's unassuming character and noble traits. 
					
					 Thus, the gift represents Ceausescu's profound reverence for Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Gobierno de RPDC ofrece banquete en honor de Mohamad Bolkiah
articles.content:
Gobierno de RPDC ofrece banquete en honor de Mohamad Bolkiah
Pyongyang, 30 de agosto (ACNC) -- El gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio un banquete el dia 30 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae en honor de Su Alteza Mohamed Bolkiah, ministro de Relaciones Exteriores y Comercio Exterior de Brunei, de visita en Corea.
					  A la recepcion fueron invitados Mohamad Bolkiah y su comitiva y la embajadora de Brunei acreditado en Corea Magdalene Teo.
					
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Yang Hyong Sop, el canciller Pak Ui Chun, el vicecanciller Pak Kil Yon y otros funcionarios coreanos.
					
					  En el banquete hubo intervenciones.
					
					  Pak Ui Chun dijo que el gobierno de Brunei se esfuerza, como estado presidente de la Asociacion de Naciones del Sudeste Asiatico (ASEAN), por la paz, estabilidad, desarrollo y prosperidad de la region.
					
					  Subrayo que en futuro tambien el gobierno de la RPDC ampliara y desarrollara las relaciones bilaterales con Brunei y cooperara intimamente  en la escena internacional incluyendo la ASEAN  y la ONU.
					
					  Mohamad Bolkiah felicito en su intervencion lo que el pueblo coreano celebro significativamente el 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					
					Diciendo que piensa en alegre el hecho de que los funcionarios de los MINREX de dos paises estrechan las cooperaciones, expreso su conviccion de que a traves del viaje, se desarrollaras y se fortaleceras las relaciones entre los dos paises.

articles.title: CNCDP denuncia presencia de bombardero nuclear de EE.UU. en Peninsula Coreana
articles.content:
CNCDP denuncia presencia de bombardero nuclear de EE.UU. en Peninsula Coreana
Pyongyang, 30 de agosto (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Comite Nacional Coreano por la Defensa de la Paz (CNCDP) hizo publica el dia 29 la siguiente declaracion:
					En estos dias, gracias a las medidas iniciativas de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y a sus esfuerzos sinceros por el mejoramiento de las relaciones de ambas partes coreanas, la paz y estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana, se encamina al relajamiento la situacion de esta region que se aproximaba al climax de enfrentamiento.
					
					Pero, esta corriente de reconciliacion y unidad enfrenta ahora graves desafios debido a la brutal campana de enfrentamiento y guerra nuclear anti-RPDC que arman Estados Unidos y los belicistas surcoreanos.
					
					El 27 de agosto, los agresores yanquis enviaron dos bombarderos estrategicos nucleares B-52H, estacionados en una base aerea del territorio norteamericano, al firmamento sobre el Sur de Corea para los ejercicios de ataque nuclear contra la RPDC y los desplegaron luego en la base de la isla Guam.
					
					Con anterioridad, por la noche del 15 de agosto y por la tarde del 21, al siguiente dia del inicio de los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Ulji Freedom Guardian", dos aviones de igual tipo sobrevolaron la isla Jik de la region surcoreana practicando el ataque nuclear contra la RPDC.
					
					La movilizacion de esos aviones, conocidos como uno de los 3 medios de ataque nuclear estrategico, que coincide con los "Ulji Freedom Guardian" en que participan enormes fuerzas armadas de EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea, constituye abierta amenaza nuclear contra la RPDC e imperdonable provocacion que parte del siniestro intento de desencadenar a toda costa la guerra nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Para colmo, los belicistas surcoreanos se suman a la ola conflictiva con la RPDC diciendo que "si se desata la guerra, deben ganarla sin falta" y "hay que mantenerse en la perfecta disposicion", lo cual genera escollos al dificilmente preparado dialogo intercoreano.
					
					Esa conducta significa una burla intolerable a la RPDC que se esfuerza con paciencia por aliviar la tension, y una locura anacronica contraria a la aspiracion de todos los coreanos y a la corriente de la epoca.
					
					Como se puede mencionar el "dialogo", la "paz verdadera" y la "estabilidad" realizando los ejercicios de guerra contra la contraparte de dialogo (RPDC) y movilizando hasta los bombarderos nucleares estrategicos?
					
					Resulta mas absurdo todavia insistir en la "renuncia nuclear" amenazando y chantajeando con armas nucleares a la RPDC.
					
					La realidad demuestra claramente que los autores principales de agravacion de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y de fomento del enfrentamiento son EE.UU. y los belicistas surcoreanos.
					
					Como ya hemos aclarado, nuestra paciencia tambien tiene limite.
					
					La paz, la estabilidad y el desarrollo de las relaciones intercoreanas no se consiguen con los esfuerzos de una parte.
					
					El imperialismo norteamericano y los belicistas de la capa militar del Sur de Corea deben tener presente que tales provocaciones, que violan la soberania de la RPDC y atentan sus maximos intereses, causaran un incidente irreparable.
					
					 Ellos deben actuar con prudencia sin interpretar mal la paciencia y el autocontrol del ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC.
